title: ESA still seems shy about sharing news on Ariane 6 rocket testing
description: Officials don't plan to broadcast a key Ariane 6 test-firing on its launch pad.

title: Internet providers that won FCC grants try to escape broadband commitments
description: "Coalition of RDOF Winners" lobbies FCC but won't reveal its full member list.

title: Meta releases open source AI audio tools, AudioCraft
description: Meta's suite of three AI models can create sound effects and music from descriptions.

title: ChromeOS is splitting the browser from the OS, getting more Linux-y
description: There's nothing official yet, but it might launch sometime this month.

title: Ryugu samples reveal traces of rock from before the Sun existed
description: Small bits of material in the asteroid contain isotopes made in specific stars.

title: Dealmaster: Back-to-school savings on tech, supplies, dorm essentials, and more
description: Back-to-school deals on physical and digital storage to keep your life organized.

title: A flawless Cygnus launch brings eras to a close
description: A once-perfect example of US-Russian space collaboration now highlights its loss.

title: Some shops will let you buy more than one Raspberry Pi at a time again
description: 1 million Pi models a month are being made until supplies return to normal.

title: Infrared light reveals hidden portrait beneath 1943 René Magritte painting
description: Research is part of broader collaborative project to study Magritte's materials and methods.

title: Embarrassed about paying Musk for Twitter Blue? You can hide the checkmark now
description: From verification symbol to source of shame: Paying users can hide blue checks.

title: IRS vows to digitize all taxpayer documents by 2025
description: All documents will be digitized as soon as they arrive at the IRS.

title: Musk’s Boring Company gets OK to dig 68 miles of tunnels under Las Vegas
description: Other municipalities might have soured on Musk's tunnels, but Las Vegas hasn't.

title: Researchers figure out how to make AI misbehave, serve up prohibited content
description: Adversarial attack involves using text strings and may be unstoppable.

title: Hosting Ars, part three: CI/CD, or how I learned to stop worrying and love DevOps
description: This time we discuss how we manage, update, and deploy the code that makes Ars work.
